title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 15 October 2014 - XWiki
content:

10:11 <andreeapopescu> has joined #xwiki  
10:14 <gdelhumeau> mflorea: Hi. I think your commit causes this: http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-platform-5.4.x/org.xwiki.platform$xwiki-platform-oldcore/29/testReport/  
10:14 <gdelhumeau> in 6.2.x too  
10:14 <mflorea> yes, I'm aware of it  
10:15 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
10:26 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
11:01 <Denis> Hi guys  
11:02 <Denis> is disabling comment/attachment/etc… is expected to completely make the feature unusable ?  
11:03 <ClemensR> I think you can always use  e.g. the object editor to add comments  
11:03 <Denis> Actually, I though the goal was to remove them from the extradoc tabs, but not from the choice of viewer  
11:03 <Denis> ok, and I can type ?viewer=attachment in the url, I know  
11:04 <Denis> what I wonder is what were our target  
11:04 <Denis> is it the behavior expected  
11:04 <Denis> ?  
11:06 <Denis> Another related question is the Show Document Annotation which works differently, while in the exact same posture  
11:08 <Denis> and my third question, is what is the purpose of showing annotation twice in both comments and annotations ?  
11:09 <Denis> the UI of the annotation feature is really crap  
11:10 <lucaa> Denis: please detail. I should have an opinion about that, but I need a more detailed version of "really crap"  
11:10 <lucaa> :)  
11:10 <lucaa> also, I need to finish something by midday 30 so I will be back with you in 1 hour  
11:11 <Denis> I am talking about the way it is now done in Flamingo  
11:11 <Denis> nothing as been adapted, this is not efficient having that separate check box  
11:11 <Denis> I have already expressed some comment about it in the discussion about the Add menu  
11:12 <Denis> and now, that doubling tab in extra tabs, the discrepency of behavior between show annotation and others shows  
11:13 <lucaa> Denis: I would need to have a closer look at the doubling of tab. Normally that tab is deactivated  
11:13 <lucaa> and is to be used if you customize the annotations config and set a different class for annotations than the one for comments (this is possible)  
11:13 <Denis> it is by default  
11:13 <Denis> but you can change that easily  
11:14 <Denis> while changing the annotation class, I do not even know how to do it  
11:14 <Denis> there is a UI, for all shows, and the annotation one seems very unrelated to the others  
11:15 <Denis> I am more and more disappointed by the inconsistencies of the UI  
11:17 <gdelhumeau> feel free to rewrite the annotation application if you have the time  
11:19 <Denis> gd: I am sorry if my remark could look hard, it is not a matter of the annotation application, it is a more general aspect about consistencies, and behavior of the whole UI  
11:20 <Denis> I have the feeling that we are taking the direction of many OS project, which get very customization but unusable UI, due to inconsistencies and independency of each features  
11:21 <Denis> s/customization/customieable  
11:21 <Denis> \*customizable  
11:26 <gdelhumeau> Then please open a JIRA with your suggestions  
11:40 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
11:43 <gdelhumeau> Denis: is XWIKI-11222 really a blocker?  
11:44 <Denis> Make the farm usage impossible  
11:45 <Denis> you are exposing sisters wikis in each wikis, which disallow using the farm (opposed to workspace) usage of subwikis  
11:46 <gdelhumeau> indeed  
11:46 <Denis> take myxwiki.org as a sample, do you expect the wiki facet in your wiki to display potential match in other wiki of the myxwiki farm ?  
11:47 <ClemensR> is this true if the user in the subwiki has no access to the other wikis (in which case they should not see any results from the other wikis anyway?)  
11:47 <Denis> probably not  
11:47 <ClemensR> (should go and try that by myself ...)  
11:47 <Denis> but this does not change anything for public farms  
11:48 <Denis> this could be seen as a feature if we take care of having it based on the type of wikis and have a option to allow or disallow it  
11:49 <Denis> for a company using wikis for their department, they may want it, or may not, even if user can read other departments wikis  
11:49 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
11:55 <gdelhumeau> mflorea: if I remove 'wiki', from 'facetFields' in Main.SolrSearchConfig, it removes the 'wiki' facets  
11:55 <gdelhumeau> but is that enough?  
11:56 <gdelhumeau> do we have something to prevent searching in other wiki that the user cannot bypass?  
11:57 <mflorea> gdelhumeau: this is not the right approach. That list doesn't mean those facets are always displayed. A facet is displayed only if the search results have multiple values for the corresponding field. In this case all results are from the same wiki so the wiki facet should not appear. Let me handle the issue.  
11:58 <gdelhumeau> ok :)  
12:03 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
12:23 <ClemensR> Hi Enygma`, as you are looking into XWIKI-8320, should I reassign the issue to you?  
12:26 <gdelhumeau> vmassol: how do we proceed for the release. You release 6.2.2 first, and then I release 5.4.6, and finally Thomas releases 6.3m1?  
12:27 <vmassol> ahah  
12:27 <vmassol> I'm fine with starting  
12:27 <vmassol> after lunch  
12:27 <tmortagne> 6.2.2 sounds like the most waited one expecially since we want it for xwiki.org upgrade  
12:27 <vmassol> in about 1 hour  
12:27 <vmassol> yep  
12:27 <vmassol> and for myxwiki.org too  
12:27 <tmortagne> yep  
12:27 <gdelhumeau> vmassol: do you wait for XWIKI-11222?  
12:28 <vmassol> argh a new one  
12:28 <vmassol> do we have anyone to work on it urgently right now?  
12:28 <gdelhumeau> mflorea is working on it  
12:28 <vmassol> ok great  
12:28 <mflorea> yep  
12:28 <vmassol> let's see in 1 hour what happens  
12:29 <vmassol> :)  
12:29 <vmassol> thanls mflorea!  
12:29 <vmassol> \*thanks  
12:29 <gdelhumeau> tmortagne: do you want to release 6.3m1 before I do 5.4.6?  
12:29 <vmassol> I'd prefer 5.4.6 before  
12:29 <vmassol> wait  
12:29 <vmassol> the opposite  
12:29 <vmassol> 6.3M1  
12:29 <vmassol> before  
12:30 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau: no its ok, will upgrade myxwiki.org with 6.2.2 while you are releasing  
12:30 <vmassol> because we're already late  
12:30 <vmassol> as you want  
12:30 <vmassol> it shouldn't take long anyway  
12:30 <tmortagne> yes  
12:30 <vmassol> is the master branch stabilized?  
12:30 <gdelhumeau> Anyway, I think I have a room to push a minor commit right now for 6.2.x and master  
12:31 <gdelhumeau> it is  
12:33 <tmortagne> out for lunch, back in 1h  
12:34 <vmassol> same  
12:39 <gdelhumeau> same  
12:45 <mflorea> gdelhumeau: I was wrong actually. We still have to display a search facet even if it has only one value, so that the user knows that all results have that value for that field. In the case of the wiki facet, the reason we see all values is because we support "multi-select faceting"  
12:45 <mflorea> http://wiki.apache.org/solr/SimpleFacetParameters#Multi-Select\_Faceting\_and\_LocalParams  
12:45 <Enygma`> ClemensR: if you don`t plan on doing it for 6.3, then I will probably take over.  
12:46 <mflorea> I could exclude  the wiki facet from the "multi-select faceting" when in a subwiki, but it's better to simply remove the wiki facet from the list as you suggested  
12:46 <ClemensR> Enygma`: I will not find time to look into it ... thanks for taking over and sorry for having this lying around so long  
12:47 <Enygma`> no harm done :)  
13:08 <DarkKnightCZ1> has joined #xwiki  
13:10 <DarkKnightCZ> has quit  
13:44 <Enygma`> has quit  
13:49 <DarkKnightCZ> has joined #xwiki  
13:50 <vmassol> nice mflorea :)  
13:50 <vmassol> just in time  
13:50 <vmassol> you think I can start the release or should I wait for the full build?  
13:50 <vmassol> depends how sure you are of yourself ;)  
13:50 <vmassol> hmm http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-ui-6.2.x/ is failing niw  
13:50 <vmassol> \*now  
13:51 <vmassol> http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-ui-6.2.x/124/testReport/  
13:52 <DarkKnightCZ1> has quit  
13:54 <vmassol> tmortagne: the failing EditObjectsTest.testPropertyDisplayersForNewObjects test started failing after your push: http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-ui-6.2.x/119/ any relationship?  
13:54 <vmassol> and LoginTest.testRedirectBackAfterLogin started failing after http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-ui-6.2.x/124/ (mflorea)  
13:55 <vmassol> let's see what the new build in progress says…  
13:55 <mflorea> vmassol: I've seen it failing before, http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-ui-6.2.x/105/  
13:56 <vmassol> ok so flicker  
13:56 <vmassol> which we need to fix....  
13:56 <mflorea> same for EditObjectsTest.testPropertyDisplayersForNewObjects, http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/140/  
13:56 <vmassol> but at least I can discard it for 6.2.2  
13:56 <tmortagne> vmassol: I really don't see how my revert could be related  
13:57 <vmassol> ok thanks  
13:57 <vmassol> starting the release (translations), please don't commit on 6.2.x  
14:01 <gdelhumeau> translations  on a point release?  
14:01 <vmassol> yes, carefully  
14:01 <gdelhumeau> ok  
14:01 <gdelhumeau> make sense if we have introduced some new ones during the stabilization  
14:01 <vmassol> if I see some removed translations then big warning  
14:01 <gdelhumeau> I mean new translation keys  
14:01 <vmassol> same if the format changed  
14:01 <vmassol> but if new translations then no problem

16:02 <Enygma`> has quit  
16:03 <xwikiorg\_guest\_0> has joined #xwiki  
16:04 <xwikiorg\_guest\_0> Hello all! Is my attempt to reload a whole wiki (200Mo+ xar file) is vain, even with 4Gb heap space?  
16:05 <vmassol> xwikiorg\_guest\_0: wdym by "reload"?  
16:05 <vmassol> you mean importing a 200MB XAR file?  
16:06 <xwikiorg\_guest\_0> Yup, uploading a production export of about 200MB to a fresh instance for upgrade purpose - got lost on the subject, still @3.5 :(  
16:06 <xwikiorg\_guest\_0> Production being hosted on Oracle, and test db being MySQL, of course, or it wouldn't be fun.  
16:06 <vmassol> you're using XWiki 3.5?  
16:07 <vmassol> that's old indeed  
16:07 <vmassol> so you'll need to use the large import extension on extensions.xwiki.org for that  
16:07 <xwikiorg\_guest\_0> No, I'm suffering Xwiki 3.5! Running along smoothly but in desperate need of an upgrade.  
16:07 <vmassol> hehe  
16:07 <vmassol> if you were using a recent version of xwiki you'd be able to use the built import/export which supports large files  
16:08 <vmassol> I aplogize for your pain! :)  
16:08 <gdelhumeau> Please hold your commits on 5.4.x  
16:08 <xwikiorg\_guest\_0> Ok, off I am to install this extension then! Thanks Vincent!  
16:17 <gdelhumeau> hey, I did not want to do that  
16:17 <gdelhumeau> ok, bad manipluation on github  
16:20 <xwikiorg\_guest\_0> vmassol: worked great, off to my upgrade! Thanks again for your help!  
16:20 <vmassol> cool  
16:20 <vmassol> glad it helped

17:03 <vmassol> mflorea: for AWM apps, in which page is the application EP located?  
17:04 <vmassol> (to show the app in the Apps panel)  
17:07 <mflorea> vmassol: app home page  
17:10 <vmassol> ok thanks  
17:10 <vmassol> didn't think of checking there … ;)  
17:10 <mflorea> :)  
17:10 <gdelhumeau> guys, I'll release 5.4.6 tomorow from home  
17:10 <gdelhumeau> I don't have my gpg key in the office -\_-  
17:18 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
17:23 <vmassol> BTW gdelhumeau we still need to reenable html validation in our build ;)  
17:24 <gdelhumeau> I know it  
17:24 <vmassol> don't know if you've looked at this but I guess not since you focused on bug fixing  
17:24 <gdelhumeau> I was working on it thi week but I'm waiting before push any commit  
17:24 <vmassol> ah you made progress?  
17:24 <vmassol> that's cool  
17:24 <gdelhumeau> I have just fixed http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-10840 but, again, I'm waiting  
17:25 <vmassol> yes I know that's what reminded me of it... ;)  
17:25 <gdelhumeau> actually I can push XWIKI-10840 on master and having it for 6.3M1 if tmortagne agrees  
17:30 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau: as you want

18:21 <Denis> Testing the latest 6.2.2… are there other that are frustrated by clicking the Home, wiki, space button and see nothing happening ?  
18:22 <Denis> This even more curious now that we have the Add button next to the others and this one is in two part  
18:22 <tmortagne> did not had much occasion to test this part of 6.2.2 so can't really tell you but that's something I'm using from time to time  
18:23 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
18:23 <tmortagne> (in older version that is)  
18:23 <Denis> this look very surprising for a existing user IMO  
18:23 <Denis> why do we change that is out of my understanding  
18:23 <tmortagne> probably, but not much more surprising that not having the menu when over it I guess  
18:24 <tmortagne> with the edit button I mean  
18:24 <Denis> this has a explanation, it does not work on my tablet or phone  
18:24 <tmortagne> yes I know  
18:25 <Denis> that said, it could be differenciate  
18:25 <Denis> d  
18:27 <Enygma`> Denis: see http://xwiki.markmail.org/thread/faodcoo4s4xpgn4j - and further in the replies  
18:27 <Enygma`> I already asked for consistency in that thread, but did not get much support from others on the matter
